pr_title: [Calcite 3663] Support for TRIM function in BigQuery dialect

timeline.message: Perform indentation for testcase and BQ

timeline.bodyText: Also need to validate the second operand?
timeline.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText: Removed this assert as the operands type check is already done in SqlTrimFunction class
replies.author: dhirenda-gautam

timeline.bodyText:
As you can see there is a comment about this test case which is hive related. So you can also add comments for BQ.
You can either add another comment for BQ, or split this test case to hive and BQ and then add comments seperately.
timeline.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText: Added the comment for the BQ test cases along with JIRA Id
replies.author: dhirenda-gautam

revised_code.chunk: diff --git a/core/src/test/java/org/apache/calcite/rel/rel2sql/RelToSqlConverterTest.java b/core/src/test/java/org/apache/calcite/rel/rel2sql/RelToSqlConverterTest.java index 980f4d9c2..3ccd02c5b 100644 --- a/core/src/test/java/org/apache/calcite/rel/rel2sql/RelToSqlConverterTest.java +++ b/core/src/test/java/org/apache/calcite/rel/rel2sql/RelToSqlConverterTest.java @@ -958,6 +958,11 @@ private static String toSql(RelNode root, SqlDialect dialect) { * [CALCITE-3220] * HiveSqlDialect should transform the SQL-standard TRIM function to TRIM, * LTRIM or RTRIM. */ + + /** Test case for + * [CALCITE-3663] + * Support for TRIM function in Bigquery dialect. */ + @Test public void testHiveAndBqTrim() { final String query = "SELECT TRIM(' str ')\n" + "from \"foodmart\".\"reserve_employee\"";

timeline.bodyText: This if logic is different with that of HiveSqlDialect. Could you add doc for it?
timeline.author: DonnyZone

replies.bodyText: Added the doc which specify the purpose of the if block
replies.author: dhirenda-gautam

timeline.message: Removed the assertion check and added the Doc for the trim handling with char
